snippet: President Obama rallied allies and approved a series of diplomatic and economic moves intended to isolate Moscow and prevent it from seizing more Ukrainian territory.
abstract: Pres Obama sends Sec of State John Kerry to Kiev, ordering series of economic and diplomatic measures against Russia as country tightens its grip on the Crimean Peninsula, yet calls persist for him to take far bolder action; Russian occupation of Crimea, with its strong Cold War overtones, presents the greatest international crisis of Obama's presidency, uniting a hawkish opposition that has been divided on other conflicts.
lead_paragraph: President Obama rallied allies and approved a series of diplomatic and economic moves intended to isolate Moscow and prevent it from seizing more Ukrainian territory.

headline.main: Pressure Rising as Obama Works to Rein In Russia
headline.print_headline: Pressure Rising as Obama Works to Rein In Russia
